slides.text:
## Cairo, Urban Sprawl

30 years of Cairo: Egypt’s sprawling capital. The first image was captured by the US Landsat-5 in 1988, the second in 2018 and the third in 2021 both from the Copernicus Sentinel-2 mission. Satellite-based images are useful in monitoring large scale urban development. 

Credits: contains modified Copernicus Sentinel data (2018), processed by ESA. USGS/ESA

## Cairo, Urban Sprawl

30 years of Cairo: Egypt’s sprawling capital. The first image was captured by the US Landsat-5 in 1988, the second in 2018 and the third in 2021 both from the Copernicus Sentinel-2 mission. Satellite-based images are useful in monitoring large scale urban development. 

Credits: contains modified Copernicus Sentinel data (2018), processed by ESA. USGS/ESA
imageCaptions: This image was acquired on 14 August 1988 and shows the city of Cairo and its surroundings more than 30 years ago
This image was acquired on 2 August 2018 and shows the city of Cairo and its surroundings
This image was acquired on 31 August 2021 and shows the city of Cairo and its surroundings
